    • Method Detail

      • findDeadlockedThreads

        static long[] findDeadlockedThreads()
        Returns the ids of deadlocked threads occurring due to either monitor or ownable synchronizer ownership. Only called if ownable synchronizer monitoring is supported.
        Returns:
        an array of thread identifiers.

      • findMonitorDeadlockedThreads

        static long[] findMonitorDeadlockedThreads()
        Returns the ids of deadlocked threads occurring due to monitor ownership.
        Returns:
        an array of thread identifiers.

      • getAllThreadIds

        static long[] getAllThreadIds()
        Returns the identifiers of all live threads.
        Returns:
        an array of thread identifiers.

      • getCurrentThreadCpuTime

        static long getCurrentThreadCpuTime()
        Returns the number of nanoseconds of CPU time the current thread has used, if supported.
        Returns:
        the number of nanoseconds.

        private static long getIDForCurrentThread()

      • getThreadCpuTime

        static long getThreadCpuTime(long id)
        Returns the number of nanoseconds of CPU time the given thread has used, if supported.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the thread to probe.
        Returns:
        the number of nanoseconds.

      • getThreadInfoForId

        static ThreadInfo getThreadInfoForId(long id,
                                     int maxDepth)
        Returns a ThreadInfo object for the given thread id with a stack trace to the given depth (0 for empty, Integer.MAX_VALUE for full).
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the thread whose info should be returned.
        maxDepth - the depth of the stack trace.
        Returns:
        a ThreadInfo instance.

      • getThreadForId

        private static Thread getThreadForId(long id)
        Returns the Thread instance for the given thread id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the thread to find.
        Returns:
        the Thread.

      • getThreadUserTime

        static long getThreadUserTime(long id)
        Returns the number of nanoseconds of user time the given thread has used, if supported.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the thread to probe.
        Returns:
        the number of nanoseconds.
